Issues.Title: Simplify include repo configuration in ml-api-docs repo
Issues.Body:
The current config in https://github.com/dotnet/ml-api-docs is:

.openpublishing.publish.config.json

    "dependent_repositories": [
     ...
        {
          "path_to_root": "docs/samples",
          "url": "https://github.com/dotnet/machinelearning",
          "branch": "master",
          "branch_mapping": {}
        }
      ],

This means that the includes have to be specified like this:

    [!code-csharp[OrdinaryLeastSquares](~/../docs/samples/docs/samples/Microsoft.ML.Samples/Dynamic/Trainers/Regression/OrdinaryLeastSquares.cs)]

and

    [!include[algorithm](~/../docs/samples/docs/api-reference/tree-featurization-prediction.md)]

If we change it to

.openpublishing.publish.config.json

    {
        "path_to_root": "dotnet/machinelearning", <-- ~ is relative to the docfx root dir i.e. dotnet
        "url": "https://github.com/dotnet/machinelearning",
        "branch": "master",
        "branch_mapping": {}
    } 

then we can specify the includes as:

    [!code-csharp[OrdinaryLeastSquares](~/machinelearning/docs/samples/Microsoft.ML.Samples/Dynamic/Trainers/Regression/OrdinaryLeastSquares.cs)]

    [!include[algorithm](~/machinelearning/docs/api-reference/tree-featurization-prediction.md)]
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Simplify include repo configuration in ml-api-docs repo" (#3966)

Issues.Title: LightGbm Warning after upgrading to LightGBM v1.2 ([LightGBM] [Warning] Unknown parameter metric=)
Issues.Body:
### System information

- **OS version/distro**: Windows Server 2016
- **.NET Version (eg., dotnet --info)**: .NET Core 2.1

### Issue

- **What did you do?** Updated to ML.NET/LightGBM v1.2
- **What happened?** Warning started appearing.
- **What did you expect?** No warning

### Source code / logs

Source code is located here:
https://github.com/bartczernicki/MLDotNet-BaseballClassification

Fit method that throws the warning...
https://github.com/bartczernicki/MLDotNet-BaseballClassification/blob/28143bb71d962bcb919393db258e7e458480f071/MLDotNet-BaseballClassification/Program.cs#L113

_Error: [LightGBM] [Warning] Unknown parameter metric=_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "LightGbm Warning after upgrading to LightGBM v1.2 ([LightGBM] [Warning] Unknown parameter metric=)" (#3965)

Issues.Title: Missing or incorrect dependencies in generated code
Issues.Body:
### System information

- **OS version/distro**:
- **.NET Version (eg., dotnet --info)**: 

### Issue

- **What did you do?**
Added machine learning to a .net core console project.
Followed the training to generate a model and added the projects to my solution.
(Note: when I created the solution I opted for solution and project in same folder)
- **What happened?**
Many Build Errors:
2>MLConsoleL1ML.ConsoleApp\ModelBuilder.cs(11,17,11,19): error CS0234: The type or namespace name 'ML' does not exist in the namespace 'Microsoft' (are you missing an assembly reference?)

- **What did you expect?**
1. Generated code to build.
2. Generated code to work.

- **What I tried to resolve it**
Installed nuget package Microsoft.ML

- **Then what happened?**
Even more errors:
2>MLConsoleL1ML.Model\obj\Debug\netcoreapp2.1\MLConsoleL1ML.Model.AssemblyInfo.cs(14,12,14,54): error CS0579: Duplicate 'System.Reflection.AssemblyCompanyAttribute' attribute

in addition to the previous errors





### Source code / logs

Please paste or attach the code or logs or traces that would be helpful to diagnose the issue you are reporting.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Missing or incorrect dependencies in generated code" (#3964)

Issues.Title: Version mismatch for Microsoft.ML.TensorFlow.Redist
Issues.Body:
The NuGet shows v0.14.0. But when I download and install, it actually v0.13.1.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1705364/60590780-811c9280-9d62-11e9-9ef9-4930a047b281.png)

https://github.com/dotnet/machinelearning/tree/master/src/Redist/Microsoft.ML.TensorFlow.Redist.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1705364/60590824-9ee9f780-9d62-11e9-8a7a-8f8cbdafac45.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Version mismatch for Microsoft.ML.TensorFlow.Redist" (#3962)

Issues.Title: Update AutoML dependency to ML.NET 1.2.0
Issues.Body:
ML.NET has released a new version (1.2.0). 

Update:
* AutoML API
* CLI & CodeGen
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Update AutoML dependency to ML.NET 1.2.0" (#3960)

Issues.Title: Bump AutoML API & CLI version to 0.14.0
Issues.Body:
To match the existing pre-release version of ML.NET, bump AutoML API and CLI nugets to 0.14.0. Currently the version is 0.4.0, and we will fast forward to 0.14.0.

This provides a uniform versioning across ML.NET.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Bump AutoML API & CLI version to 0.14.0" (#3959)

Issues.Title: [AutoML] Produce AutoML NuGet package in build pipeline
Issues.Body:
Produce AutoML NuGet package in build pipeline

Currently, only the `mlnet` and _symbols_ for `Microsoft.ML.AutoML` are produced. We need to also produce the NuGet for `Microsoft.ML.AutoML`.

This reverts the change from https://github.com/dotnet/machinelearning/pull/3656.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "[AutoML] Produce AutoML NuGet package in build pipeline" (#3961)

Issues.Title: [AutoML] Bump ML.NET package version to 1.2.0 in AutoML API and CLI; and AutoML package versions to 0.14.0
Issues.Body:
Closes https://github.com/dotnet/machinelearning/issues/3959 and closes https://github.com/dotnet/machinelearning/issues/3960:
Bump ML.NET package version to latest 1.2.0 in AutoML API and CLI (including the generated C# code); bump AutoML package versions to 0.14.0 to be consistent with ML.NET preview version
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "[AutoML] Bump ML.NET package version to 1.2.0 in AutoML API and CLI; and AutoML package versions to 0.14.0" (#3958)

Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Release notes for 1.2.0 release." (#3951)

Issues.Title: Reformatted Regression samples to width 85
Issues.Body:
Guidelines followed:

- 85 characters per line
- Use 4 spaces for indentation
- Dot, open parentheses, and function/variable name on same line
- Math operations on same line
- Don't indent comments
- Don't break links
- Don't break a comment if it represents a print output
- Add an extra line after a break if it does not already exist
- Break before "$"
Fix for Issue #3478
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Reformatted Regression samples to width 85" (#3948)

Issues.Title: Reformatting BinaryClassification samples to width 85
Issues.Body:
Guidelines followed:
-85 characters per line
-Use 4 spaces for indentation
-Dot and open parentheses stay on same line as function
-If not a preexisting line under line that we break, add an extra line after it
-Don't indent comments
-Don't break a comment if it represents output
-Don't break links
-If applicable, break right before $
-Keep math op together

Fix for issue #3478
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Reformatting BinaryClassification samples to width 85" (#3946)

Issues.Title: [AutoML] CLI: Regenerate templated CS files
Issues.Body: Regenerate all templated CS files from checked-in TT files. (I unknowingly upgraded CS files to be FXCop / StyleCop compliant in https://github.com/dotnet/machinelearning/pull/3823 . This was unnecessary. I did not modify TT files. I'm reverting my FXCop / StyleCop change to the generated files by regenerating them from the checked-in TT files.)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "[AutoML] CLI: Regenerate templated CS files" (#3954)

Issues.Title: Update .gitattributes
Issues.Body:
We are excited to review your PR.

So we can do the best job, please check:

- [ ] There's a descriptive title that will make sense to other developers some time from now. 
- [ ] There's associated issues. All PR's should have issue(s) associated - unless a trivial self-evident change such as fixing a typo. You can use the format `Fixes #nnnn` in your description to cause GitHub to automatically close the issue(s) when your PR is merged.
- [ ] Your change description explains what the change does, why you chose your approach, and anything else that reviewers should know.
- [ ] You have included any necessary tests in the same PR.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Update .gitattributes" (#3955)

Issues.Title: Remove Static API code
Issues.Body: Since we are closing Static API issues with "no development is being done on static API" (ex. https://github.com/dotnet/machinelearning/issues/1153#issuecomment-507014868), we should just remove the Static API code from the repo. If we need it again in the future, we can get it out of source control history. But there is no reason to build and maintain this code anymore.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Remove Static API code" (#3952)

Issues.Title: Add AVX and FMA intrinsics in Factorization Machine
Issues.Body:
Added AVX and FMA C# intrinsics in Microsoft.ML.StandardTrainers for Factorization Machine algorithm  which currently implements C++ SSE code as suggested in #3000 and #3785

@wschin @eerhardt
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Add AVX and FMA intrinsics in Factorization Machine" (#3940)

Issues.Title: MathJax Formatting in Section Scoring Function
Issues.Body:
The details on the scoring function for this trainer are unreadable as it appear the mathjax is not escaped properly

* GitHub Login: @sfilipi
* Microsoft Alias: **johalex**
